jobPostingInfo.title: Senior Systems Engineer V TS/SCI (Special Programs)
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities:

The Project Systems Engineering & Formulation Section (312) provides life-cycle leadership in the formulation, planning and execution of the project systems engineering function for JPL space flight missions from concept development through completion of post-Launch checkout and commissioning. We provide formulation services from concept ideation, to the full expression of that concept in formulation phase products. The creative and innovative personnel in our Section are responsible for the leadership for project-wide systems engineering efforts, and the delivery of project-level systems engineering products. The Section’s expertise spans a wide array of project products and disciplines, including Project-level requirements, Project-level trade studies, Risk Management, and Exploration of very large mission-level trade spaces.

We invite you to join JPL's Project Systems Engineering & Formulation team to serve as a senior systems engineer for the Defense and Commercial Programs group.

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Systems Engineer V to work in a leadership capacity on technology developments and cutting-edge demonstrations for the National Security Program Office.   You will report programmatically to the project management and administratively to the Defense and Commercial Programs Project Systems Engineering Group (312H) Supervisor in the Project System Engineering and Formulation Section (312).

Innovation drives so much of what we do at JPL, and our inclusiveness helps drive that innovation.

As a member of the 312H team, your major responsibilities may include:

  • In conjunction with the Project System Engineer, leading and managing the project system requirements, design, technical resources, system and project interfaces, payload accommodation and integration, and verification and validation throughout the project’s life cycle.

  • Partnering with the Project System Engineer in managing risks, performance error budgets, trade studies, design integration, requirements definition and flow-down, interface definition/verification, and verification and validation planning and execution across the Project.

  • Supporting the Project System Engineer in the detailed definition of the scope, approach, technical implementation, risk decisions, performance commitments, schedule, and resources of the Project System Engineer element.

  • Co-Leading the Project System Engineering Team meetings and tracking of technical actions.

  • Supporting the Project System Engineer in the staffing, execution, and budget control of the Project System Engineer work element.

  • Development of materials for project-level reviews.

  • Negotiating receivables and deliverables across and between the project system elements. Interacting extensively with partner institutions

Qualifications:

The well-qualified candidate possesses knowledge of the function, design and operation of a spacecraft, its subsystems, and scientific payloads, with knowledge in all of the major systems engineering sub-function areas. Minimum qualifications include:

  • Demonstrated ability to perform, lead and deliver the systems engineering functions at the project level including the ability to form and lead multidisciplinary, cross-system team inside and outside of JPL

  • Experience in leading flight project teams, coordinating and working in a collaborative environment with support contractors.

  • Demonstrated ability to interact with project managers, the science team, line managers, contract technical managers and external vendors

  • Experience with developing space mission systems and establishing interfaces with external organizations.

  • Familiarity with the NASA/JPL Project Life Cycle and experience with the delivery of systems engineering gate products.

  • Familiarity with fault management methodologies, processes and products.

  • Familiarity with mission, trajectory, navigation design

  • Ability to lead a comprehensive flight project requirements development and verification/validation program, establish technical interfaces and to develop recommendations for addressing technical issues and project risks and associated mitigation plans.

  • Significant expertise in one or more specific technical fields, as well as knowledge of industry and/or academic practices and standards across a range of applications related to the following:

    • aerospace engineering

    • Project or Flight systems engineering

In order to be considered for this job, you should have already demonstrated the following career development characteristics:

  • Ph.D. degree in Aerospace Engineering or similar discipline with 8+ years work experience, or MA/MS degree in similar discipline with 10+ years work experience or BA/BS degree in similar discipline with 12+ years work experience.

  • Ability to lead the activities of, and to synthesize the unique discipline knowledge of, a broad range of technical subject matter experts.

  • Demonstrated excellence in dealing with multiple issues, tasks, and priorities concurrently.

  • Experience in leading, coordinating and working in a collaborative environment with JPL managers, project and JPL institutional teams, NASA Centers and contractors.

  • Knowledge of industry and/or academic practices and standards across a range of applications related to the systems engineering discipline.

  • Working knowledge of Laboratory policies and procedures, NASA policies and procedures, and government regulations in Mission Assurance and general project practices.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including demonstrated presentation skills.

  • Excellent problem-solving skills.

Note: Must be a U.S. Citizen with an active Top Secret (TS) clearance based upon Single Scope Background Investigation (SSBI) within a 5 year scope and must be approved for Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) accesses.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
